Quiconque le souhaite peut apporter des modifications et des am√©liorations √† cette liste sur ce d√©p√¥t GitHub. üü¢¬†‚úÖ¬†üòÄ¬†

Selphira

AutoDescription est un mod, pour BG2, BGT, BGEE, BG2EE et EET, d√©velopp√© sur La Couronne de Cuivre, qui g√©n√®re et remplace automatiquement la description "technique" des objets et des sortil√®ges.

Cela comporte plusieurs avantages:
- Les descriptions sont normalis√©es, ce qui les rend plus facile √† lire- La description s'adapte aux √©ventuelles modifications r√©alis√©es par les mods et les harmonise avec le reste du jeu- En comparant les descriptions avant/apr√®s, on peut d√©tecter d'√©ventuels bugs, erreurs ou incompatibilit√©s entre mods et sur le jeu de base.- Si des mods non-traduits sont install√©s, les statistiques des objets de ces mods seront automatiquement traduites et harmonis√©es.

√Ä l'origine, ce mod a √©t√© pens√© pour √™tre utilis√© par les joueurs, en √©tant install√© apr√®s tous les mods ajoutant ou alt√©rant des objets.En effet, AutoDescription s'adapte √† tous les mods install√©s par l'utilisateur, si les capacit√©s de certains objets sont alt√©r√©es, celles-ci seront mises √† jour afin que leur description corresponde √† la r√©alit√© et dans votre langue d'origine.

En pratique, il s'av√®re qu'AutoDescription peut aussi √™tre utilis√© dans le d√©veloppement de mods, √† divers niveaux...

C√¥t√© traducteurs, il permet de traduire automatiquement les statistiques contenues dans les descriptions de la plupart des objets, √©vitant ainsi une t√¢che souvent p√©nible et redondante.

C√¥t√© d√©veloppeurs, il peut mettre en √©vidence certains probl√®mes, incoh√©rences ou bugs dans les objets en traduisant les effets avec fiabilit√©. A cet effet, quelques erreurs et avertissements sont remont√©s dans un fichier de log. Le mod n'√©tant pas destin√© √† cela √† la base, la liste des erreurs remont√©es par ce biais est encore faible, mais elle s'√©toffera au fil du temps.

BG1 engine FIX - extending limit of maximum GLOBAL variables

üü¢¬†‚úÖ¬†üòÄ¬†

BG

Ce petit mod est essentiel car il vous permet de terminer BG avec des mods de qu√™te en √©vitant de s√©rieuses difficult√©s.
Le moteur de BG utilise des variables pour la m√©morisation de divers √©v√®nements et leur nombre est limit√©. Les nouvelles variables globales et les timers qui d√©passent cette limite sont simplement ignor√©s. Le jeu ne plante pas, mais vous rencontrez de s√©rieuses difficult√©s et l'intrigue est arr√™t√©e. BG+TotSC g√®re seulement 1024 variables globales, et BG sans TotSC est encore plus limit√©, avec seulement 512 variables globales. Si vous jouez avec plus d'un mod de qu√™te, les difficult√©s surviennent tard dans le jeu (g√©n√©ralement au chapitre 5 ou plus).
Pour √©viter ce probl√®me, ce mod √©tend la limite des variables GLOBALES √† 4096 par la modification d'un octet dans le fichier EXE.

√Ä n'utiliser que pour un jeu BG original, sans Tutu ni BGT.

IWD:EE compatibility fixer

üü¢¬†‚úÖ¬†üòÄ¬†

IWDEE

If you've played IWDEE with mod kits, you may have noticed many kits aren't actually compatible with IWDEE, even if they say they are. Kits will generally work, but they'll be missing IWDEE abilities, or in the case of druids or paladins, have completely wrong abilities.

I decided to do something about it (a long time ago, but only getting it done now). There's also a component for Tome and Blood's Innate Metamagic (options 1 and 2). More details below.

Components:
- Kit mods
- Innate Metamagic (Tome & Blood)

See more detailed info in readme...

Generalized Biffing (mise en bif g√©n√©ralis√©e) est extr√™mement important pour √©viter des ralentissements en jeu si votre installation contient beaucoup de mods.
Ce n'est pas vraiment un mod, mais un outil √©crit avec WeiDU et s'installant comme un mod. Son principe est de cr√©er des fichiers BIF √† partir des fichiers de mods ou modifi√©s par des mods et pr√©sents dans le r√©pertoire Override du jeu.
La technique du "Biffing" a un objectif principal : r√©duire les ralentissements dans le jeu. En particulier, ceux observ√©s lors du chargement d'une partie, de l'acc√®s √† une zone, ... En effet, la pr√©sence d'un tr√®s grand nombre de fichiers dans le r√©pertoire Override provoque des ralentissements plus ou moins importants (selon le nombre de fichiers, les performances de l'ordinateur et en particulier du disque dur). √Ä chaque fichier cherch√© par le jeu, il doit d'abord v√©rifier s'il est dans le r√©pertoire Override puis, en cas d'√©chec, aller le chercher dans les fichiers BIF existants (du jeu original ou de certains m√©ga-mods). Ces fichiers BIF ressemblent √† des archives zip : ils contiennent un ensemble de fichiers auquel le jeu sait acc√©der gr√¢ce √† un sommaire qui lui permet de les retrouver. Cette m√©thode est plus performante car le nombre de fichiers BIF est tr√®s r√©duit et le jeu passe bien moins de temps √† les trouver sur le disque dur. C'est d'ailleurs ainsi que le jeu exploite les fichiers du jeu de base : ils sont tous inclus dans les fichiers BIF des r√©pertoires Data, Movies, et des r√©pertoires CD2, CD3, ...
De fait, le biffing est plut√¥t r√©serv√© √† ceux qui effectuent des m√©ga-installations ou qui installent un grand nombre de mods qui modifient √©norm√©ment de fichiers du jeu, tels que les mods de "Tweak".
M√™me si Generalized Biffing laisse possible la d√©installation ult√©rieure de mods install√©s avant lui, il faut bien √™tre conscient que cette d√©sinstallation pourra bien durer tr√®s tr√®s longtemps, voire des heures enti√®res ! Vous avez donc tout int√©r√™t √† n'employer Generalized Biffing que lorsque vous √™tes √† peu-pr√®s certains de ne pas avoir √† retoucher votre installation.

Attention : De par sa nature, il s'installera g√©n√©ralement en dernier, mais je vous invite fortement √† lire ce sujet avant de songer √† l'utiliser.

Tout comme ce dernier, il vous permet de t√©l√©charger, extraire et installer automatiquement des mods, tout en g√©rant les conflits, d√©pendances et ordres d'installation. Il propose ainsi une alternative fonctionnelle √† l'outil Project Infinity, toujours en phase de d√©veloppement, dont l'utilisation est pour le moins peu intuitive et qui est encore tr√®s loin d'√™tre au point.
Ses fonctions principales :
- Il permet de s√©lectionner les mods et composants que vous d√©sirez, et se charge d'automatiser enti√®rement le processus d'installation.
- Il supporte les pr√©s√©lections de mods.

- Il extrait automatiquement la plupart des mods.
- Il se charge de g√©rer l'ordre d'installation.
- Il vous indique les conflits √©ventuels de votre s√©lection, et vous propose des solutions pour les √©viter.
- Il applique des corrections sur certains mods.
Vous pouvez consultez le Forum d√©di√© pour de plus ample informations et acc√©der aux Guides d'utilisation.

Cela comporte plusieurs avantages:
- Les descriptions sont normalis√©es, ce qui les rend plus facile √† lire- La description s'adapte aux √©ventuelles modifications r√©alis√©es par les mods et les harmonise avec le reste du jeu- En comparant les descriptions avant/apr√®s, on peut d√©tecter d'√©ventuels bugs, erreurs ou incompatibilit√©s entre mods et sur le jeu de base.- Si des mods non-traduits sont install√©s, les statistiques des objets de ces mods seront automatiquement traduites et harmonis√©es.

√Ä l'origine, ce mod a √©t√© pens√© pour √™tre utilis√© par les joueurs, en √©tant install√© apr√®s tous les mods ajoutant ou alt√©rant des objets.En effet, AutoDescription s'adapte √† tous les mods install√©s par l'utilisateur, si les capacit√©s de certains objets sont alt√©r√©es, celles-ci seront mises √† jour afin que leur description corresponde √† la r√©alit√© et dans votre langue d'origine.

En pratique, il s'av√®re qu'AutoDescription peut aussi √™tre utilis√© dans le d√©veloppement de mods, √† divers niveaux...

C√¥t√© traducteurs, il permet de traduire automatiquement les statistiques contenues dans les descriptions de la plupart des objets, √©vitant ainsi une t√¢che souvent p√©nible et redondante.

üü¢¬†‚úÖ¬†üòÄ¬†

BG+TotSC g√®re seulement 1024 variables globales, et BG sans TotSC est encore plus limit√©, avec seulement 512 variables globales. Si vous jouez avec plus d'un mod de qu√™te, les difficult√©s surviennent tard dans le jeu (g√©n√©ralement au chapitre 5 ou plus).
Pour √©viter ce probl√®me, ce mod √©tend la limite des variables GLOBALES √† 4096 par la modification d'un octet dans le fichier EXE.

Infinity Animations prend en charge les types d'animation tr√®s divers des jeux Baldur's Gate I, Baldur's Gate II, Icewind Dale I, Icewind Dale II, Planescape: Torment et Neverwinter Nights. En bonus, le mod r√©tablit l'int√©gralit√© des animations de personnages de Baldur's Gate I, et permet √† certaines animations qui n'en avaient pas jusqu'√† pr√©sent de disposer dor√©navant d'un paperdoll (silhouette dans l'√©cran des personnages).
Point important pour les joueurs installant plusieurs mods cons√©quents (appel√©s ¬´ mega-mods ¬ª), Infinity Animations r√©sout les conflits de slots d'animation (plusieurs mods utilisant les m√™mes slots pour des animations diff√©rentes, le dernier install√© √©crase les modifications effectu√©es par les pr√©c√©dents) et r√©tablit les animations de base que les mega-mods ont modifi√©es.
Enfin, il comporte des composants optionnels qui introduisent de nombreuses nouvelles animations dans le jeu, ainsi que leurs jeux de sons associ√©s (soundsets). Bien que le nombre d'animations support√©es ne soit pas ¬´ infini ¬ª, comme le nom du mod l'indique, il devrait toutefois √™tre assez important pour r√©pondre aux besoins actuels (et probablement futurs) de tout le monde.

Ne pas oublier de t√©l√©charger tous les fichiers d'animation et les d√©compresser dans le dossier "infinityanimations/content" avant d'installer le mod.

Alabaster sands

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BG2

BG2EE

EET

Alabaster Sands is a small quest mod from the Athkatlan Grounds quest mod series, which adds new areas and quests to Shadow of Amn's main city location. There is one main quest, and a few smaller ones, all oriented around the titular area, which is nothing else but Athkatla's public beach. So visit the place, help those you'll meet there, and see this brand new part of the City of Coin.
The mod adds 7 new quests that introduce new characters, items, and item graphics.

Il ajoute 5 qu√™tes (plus ou moins importantes) comportant de nouvelles zones, de nouveaux monstres (des morts-vivants en particulier) et 9 nouveaux personnages recrutables. Il ajoute aussi de nouveaux sorts et objets r√©partis un peu partout dans le jeu, soit sur des adversaires existants, soit sur de nouveaux personnages, soit encore dans des magasins ou des lieux.
La version BG1 (v106) est traduite en fran√ßais, la version BG:EE (v102) de Red Carnelian ne l'est pas. Malheureusement, √† l'installation de la version BG1, le fran√ßais n'est plus disponible...

The Gorgon's Eye

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BGEE

EET

The Gorgon's Eye is a small content mod for BG:EE/SoD and EET that adds an underground thieves den into the town of Beregost. It contains 20 new quests, 2 new areas(reused), dozens of new characters, a new store that buys stolen goods, a few new items and a very small item-upgrade. It can be accessed immediately after leaving Candlekeep and is open to all players, excluding those with a lawful-good alignment.

The Journey to the Whin Hill

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BG2EE

EET

The Journey to the Whin Hill is an IWD-style adventure for BG2EE, in which you are sent to find a man in a new area known as the Whin Hill. However beware, as the place is known to be a home for wyverns, but... that's not the only threat you will find there. Also... why would anyone live in such a place? Find out, by visiting this new area and following the path under the hill.

There is also a bonus component: the mod includes a secret optional companion you may add to your game: Afu-Zuuvi, a chaotic neutral cleric/thief. He has less content than fully-fledged companions, but still includes a few short talks with the PC, 1 banter talk with each BioWare / Beamdog NPC in SoA and 1 in ToB. He also includes some interjections, a personal kit, soundset and a couple of items. You may also install basic player-initiated dialogues (an optional component).

Cassia-NPC

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

IWDEE

This mod adds a new joinable companion to the IWD:EE - the tiefling Cassia. Cassia is a young cleric of Helm who originally hails from Mirabar and has journeyed to Easthaven at the behest of her church to render what aid she can to Hrothgar's expedition. As a devout helmite, she will do everything in her power to protect the Ten Towns and to root out the evils which threaten them. But will she find herself equal to the task or will she break beneath the responsibility?

Cassia is a single-classed cleric with the Helm kit and may be recruited outside the Temple of Tempus in Easthaven. She has a small quest associated with her which will naturally conclude over the course of the game and may be romanced by male dwarves, humans, elves, half-elves and half-orcs with a charisma score of 10 or higher. She will react and interject to both the main game and the expansion. She tends to get along better with good aligned characters but she will not object to following the lead of an evil player so long as they don't cross the moral event horizon.

Cassia has crossmod content with many mods created by Lava !

Fhaugy is a neutral half-orc monk

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BG2EE

EET

Fhaugy is a neutral half-orc monk, a member of the Twin Tusks circle, which unites individuals who hope to achieve balance ‚Äî not just the one of nature, but that between inner peace and the will to impact the world. While there is still some anger and burdening experience he finds hard to forget, he does not want to give in to his darker side but find a way to keep things in check. He also has a sense of humor he will gladly share with you, his potential leader and friend.

The Fhaugy mod includes personal quests (1 in SoA and 1 in ToB), friendship talks, and a romance option for a male protagonist of any alignment except for chaotic evil and with 13+ Charisma. Furthermore, Fhaugy has his own custom monk kit (Twin Tusks Monk) and a new half-orc monk inventory paperdoll.

You can find Fhaugy in the Umar Inn in Imnesvale.

Lhannd Valdove, a chaotic good fallen ranger

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BG2EE

Meet Lhannd Valdove, a chaotic good fallen ranger. He hails from a once-noble Athkatlan family who lost their legacy and drowned in problems. Will you lend a hand in breaking what others perceive as a curse, or will the chain of unfortunate events continue?

The mod comprises quests that expand Athkatla's Government District, including the addition of the Valdove Estate, situated above the local prison. If you are open to offering Lhannd a sympathetic ear, you may embark on a friendship or romance path that will help you get to know him even better, and... perhaps see his other side. Both men and women may romance him, however, the player character can't be of chaotic evil alignment for the romance to start.

To find Lhannd, venture into the Crooked Crane tavern located at the City Gates. The initial encounter serves as the starting point for his first quest.

The Gorgon's Eye

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BGEE

EET

The Gorgon's Eye is a small content mod for BG:EE/SoD and EET that adds an underground thieves den into the town of Beregost. It contains 20 new quests, 2 new areas(reused), dozens of new characters, a new store that buys stolen goods, a few new items and a very small item-upgrade. It can be accessed immediately after leaving Candlekeep and is open to all players, excluding those with a lawful-good alignment.

Fhaugy is a neutral half-orc monk

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BG2EE

EET

Fhaugy is a neutral half-orc monk, a member of the Twin Tusks circle, which unites individuals who hope to achieve balance ‚Äî not just the one of nature, but that between inner peace and the will to impact the world. While there is still some anger and burdening experience he finds hard to forget, he does not want to give in to his darker side but find a way to keep things in check. He also has a sense of humor he will gladly share with you, his potential leader and friend.

The Fhaugy mod includes personal quests (1 in SoA and 1 in ToB), friendship talks, and a romance option for a male protagonist of any alignment except for chaotic evil and with 13+ Charisma. Furthermore, Fhaugy has his own custom monk kit (Twin Tusks Monk) and a new half-orc monk inventory paperdoll.

You can find Fhaugy in the Umar Inn in Imnesvale.

Jamella's Diablo2 Item Store

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BG2

BGT

BGEE

BG2EE

SoD

EET

Ce mod ajoute la marchande Jamella qui vend 108 objets de Diablo 2. Vous la trouverez sur son bateau apr√®s avoir quitt√© Spellhold ou dans les Monts de la Marche (ToB). Pour ne pas d√©s√©quilibrer le jeu, vous ne pourrez acheter qu'un objet, et il vous coutera la moiti√© de votre bourse. Faites le bon choix !.

Players can choose the location of Jamella from the Werewolf Isle (BG1), the Boareskyr Bridge (SOD), the ship leaving spellhold (SOA), and the Marching Mountains (TOB). Players have only one chance to trade with her by losting all the money and then to buy a few items with limited funds (prices modification of charisma and reputation is valid).

If Diablo2 Kits are installed after this Item Store, there is still a chance (only once) for activing the interaction by installing the component [Attain ability of recognizing Diablo2 Kits for Jamella] of this MOD. Such component is often skipped in other cases.
The interactive content is as follows:
The more teammates choose Diablo2 Kits, the more funds you have for buying equipments in her store.

Note: Multiple teammate with a same kit is not supported in Diablo2 Kits MOD, as well as this MOD.

Lhannd Valdove, a chaotic good fallen ranger

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BG2EE

Meet Lhannd Valdove, a chaotic good fallen ranger. He hails from a once-noble Athkatlan family who lost their legacy and drowned in problems. Will you lend a hand in breaking what others perceive as a curse, or will the chain of unfortunate events continue?

The mod comprises quests that expand Athkatla's Government District, including the addition of the Valdove Estate, situated above the local prison. If you are open to offering Lhannd a sympathetic ear, you may embark on a friendship or romance path that will help you get to know him even better, and... perhaps see his other side. Both men and women may romance him, however, the player character can't be of chaotic evil alignment for the romance to start.

To find Lhannd, venture into the Crooked Crane tavern located at the City Gates. The initial encounter serves as the starting point for his first quest.

Akuns-Gear

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BGEE

This is an item mod that contains 2 enchanted katanas and 1 armor for a Wizard Slayer. All items are only equippable for the Wizard Slayer fighter subclass at level 4.

The items can be bought from the merchant Erdane in the Durlags Tower area(outside of Durlags Tower). The trader sells the items directly from his stock (no dialogue options). Regular price is thousands of gold per item.

Since it dynamically writes a new item category into the system, it is recommended to install this mod last.

iiItem doit √™tre install√© apr√®s les mods qui ajoutent de nouvelles cr√©atures ou de nouveaux magasins, afin de s'assurer que les nouveaux objets sont dispers√©s de mani√®re √©gale dans le jeu, et ne sont pas seulement ajout√©s aux fichiers de base du jeu.

Duskblade

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BGEE

BG2EE

SoD

EET

"My blade and my magic are one and the same."

Ce mod ajoute un nouveau profil de guerrier, pouvant canaliser la magie dans ses armes.

The Duskblade blurs the line between spellcaster and warrior, marrying the power of magic with hand-to-hand combat prowess.A student of arcane spellcasting techniques, the Duskblade combines arcane spellcasting with the combat skills of a fighter.

Disadvantages:
- May only specialise 2 stars in weapons
- Can't dualclass
- Can't use bows and missile weapons
- Can't wear armor heavier than splint mail
- Min Intellect 14
- No Greater Whirlwind
- -13% EXP penalty

Advantages:
- Arcane Channelling
- Can use magic while wearing armor

Alabaster sands

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BG2

BG2EE

EET

Alabaster Sands is a small quest mod from the Athkatlan Grounds quest mod series, which adds new areas and quests to Shadow of Amn's main city location. There is one main quest, and a few smaller ones, all oriented around the titular area, which is nothing else but Athkatla's public beach. So visit the place, help those you'll meet there, and see this brand new part of the City of Coin.
The mod adds 7 new quests that introduce new characters, items, and item graphics.

Ce mod compilait plusieurs autres mods : les G3 Tweak Pack, Tutu Tweak Pack et Wes Weimer's Ease of Use. Il permettait de faire mille et un petits ajustements au jeu. Vous pouviez faire des changements purement esth√©tiques (comme masquer les casques sur les avatars, utiliser les incantations visuelles d'Icewind Dale...) ou de r√®gles (suppression de la limite d'XP, changement des tables d'exp√©riences, lancement de sorts en armures) et assouplir certains m√©canismes du jeu (empilement illimit√© de munitions, multi-romances...).
Il est d√©sormais obsol√®te et a √©t√© remplac√© par Tweaks Anthology.

In love, Undeath

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BG2EE

EET

he mod adds a new set of quests, all oriented around the Temple of Evening Glory, known also as the Deathless Beauty and the Eternal Lover. She is a goddess of love, beauty, and immortality through undeath. The temple itself welcomes the undead, especially those that feel beauty and passion do not have to end with death.

The mod also adds a new companion, Xzel√´ Melaenitt, the paladin of Evening Glory, a woman of power, who wants to protect her friends, who in her opinion - even though touched by undeath - carry much beauty that cannot be dimmed by the lack of a pulse. However, to make her join, she will first need to know her friends are safe and nothing bad is going to happen to them while she's helping you.

She has a series of talks, her own kit and abilities... and under the right circumstances, she may feel a connection to a male Child of Bhaal. The conditions, though, demand a certain change.

Mortuary-Be-Gone

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

PSTEE

This mod (inspired by the Dungeon-Be-Gone and Skip Chateau Irenicus mods for Baldur's Gate 2) allows Morte to whisk you through a portal at the very start of the game while still providing the items and experience you'd gain from a thorough exploration of the Mortuary. Narratively, you are implied to have done a "normal" playthrough of the Mortuary in your previous incarnation, who died shortly (and relatively non-traumatically) after escaping the Mortuary.

This mod makes a few assumptions about your previous incarnation's decisions within the Mortuary. As the Mortuary is still accessible after escaping from it, I have minimized the impact that you could have had while still completing secondary objectives. You are assumed to have looted every container, avoided combat and detection wherever possible, completed every available side quest, and not taken any actions that would influence your alignment. The Dustmen will have restocked any non-unique item should you return to the Mortuary later..

Polymorph (and other) fixes

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

IWDEE

Components:
- Polymorph fixes for IWD:EE
- Polymorph fixes for IWD:EE
- Patch for nymph.BCS (fixes crash with EEex)
- Should shapeshift movement bonuses bypass Free Action?
- Increase movement speed of Winter Wolf and Polar Bear forms
- Uncap Crippling Strike (capped at -7 in v2.5 and v2.6.6)
- Patch shortbows to use shortbow visuals (as in classic IWD)
- Object.ids - Add identifiers if missing (for scripting)
- Minor AI tweak (enemies and invisible PCs)

Install info:
- All components can be installed independently and in any order.
- Component 1 assumes you are using vanilla Shapechange forms. Install before mods that change creature stats (ex. Improved HoF)
- Components 3-6 will not conflict with similar components in the mod Better IWD Pregen.

See additional info...

The Journey to the Whin Hill

üü¢¬†‚ùå¬†üòÄ¬†

BG2EE

EET

The Journey to the Whin Hill is an IWD-style adventure for BG2EE, in which you are sent to find a man in a new area known as the Whin Hill. However beware, as the place is known to be a home for wyverns, but... that's not the only threat you will find there. Also... why would anyone live in such a place? Find out, by visiting this new area and following the path under the hill.

There is also a bonus component: the mod includes a secret optional companion you may add to your game: Afu-Zuuvi, a chaotic neutral cleric/thief. He has less content than fully-fledged companions, but still includes a few short talks with the PC, 1 banter talk with each BioWare / Beamdog NPC in SoA and 1 in ToB. He also includes some interjections, a personal kit, soundset and a couple of items. You may also install basic player-initiated dialogues (an optional component).
